# braintrustdata_org (Resource)

Manages a Braintrust organization's settings.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Manage the current organization (explicit org_id shown for clarity).
resource "braintrustdata_org" "current" {
  org_id = "org-***" # replace with real organization ID, or rely on provider organization_id

  # Optional organization settings can be managed when needed.
  image_rendering_mode = "click_to_load"
}

output "organization" {
  value = {
    id                  = braintrustdata_org.current.id
    name                = braintrustdata_org.current.name
    image_rendering_mode = braintrustdata_org.current.image_rendering_mode
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `api_url` (String) The API URL for organization-scoped endpoints.
- `image_rendering_mode` (String) Controls image rendering behavior in Braintrust UI. Valid values: `auto`, `click_to_load`, `blocked`.
- `is_dataplane_private` (Boolean) Whether dataplane access is private for this organization.
- `is_universal_api` (Boolean) Whether the organization uses universal API routing.
- `name` (String) The name of the organization.
- `org_id` (String) The organization ID to manage. Defaults to the provider's organization_id.
- `proxy_url` (String) The proxy URL used by this organization.
- `realtime_url` (String) The realtime websocket URL used by this organization.

### Read-Only

- `created` (String) The timestamp when the organization was created.
- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the organization.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Organizations can be imported using their ID
terraform import braintrustdata_org.current org-id-here
```
